cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 120 mi SE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn west on Thursday, then west-northwest Friday and northwest toward the central Louisiana coast by early Saturday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Morgan City–Cameron, LA
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: N/A – the center remains well east of the Calhoun Port coastline throughout the event

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch: Pearl River‒Intracoastal City, LA; Hurricane Watch: Mouth of Mississippi River‒Cameron, LA; Tropical-Storm Watch: Mouth of Mississippi River‒Pearl River
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued yet (all are watches at this time)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast, especially Louisiana and Mississippi coasts
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (main core rainfall remains east of port)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (surge focus east of Texas-Louisiana border)
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤13%) of brief tropical-storm-force gusts; sustained winds generally below gale force
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor water level rises (<3 ft) possible along the mid-Texas coast with persistent on-shore fetch, but significant surge not expected
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands may bring 1–3 inches of rain Friday–Saturday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated marine squalls could temporarily disrupt vessel traffic, otherwise no major port-specific hazards expected
